alert.note: Alert for Columbia; Hempstead; Lafayette; Miller; Nevada; Union (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 23 at 2:27PM CST until January 23 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. Look for additional rainfall amounts through 6 pm Wednesday to range from one to three inches with isolated higher amounts, especially across portions of South Central Arkansas. * WHERE...Portions of Arkansas, including the following counties, Columbia, Hempstead, Lafayette, Miller, Nevada and Union and northeast Texas, including the following counties, Camp, Cass, Franklin, Morris and Titus. * WHEN...Through Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Columbia; Hempstead; Lafayette; Miller; Nevada; Union
